s.text: And while the soundness of expert opinion from journalists such as Fairley or Jane Bryant Quinn or Andrew Tobias is easy to overestimate, surely some training or experience is necessary before you start telling people what to do with their money.

Though the packaging of the book is clearly meant to communicate, "buy this and get rich!" (let's be grateful the publisher didn't make the Carville allusion more explicit and call the book It's About the Money, Stupid! ), the Rev. Jackson would probably say he's preaching not the gospel of wealth but the gospel of financial responsibility and independence.
